alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 8:05AM PDT until November 05 at 10:55PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .Six to nine inches of rain fell over the Central and Southern Washington Cascades Friday. The heavy rain has come to an end early Saturday morning. Area rivers continue to respond. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...covering nearby farm lands and several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM PDT Saturday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 20.0 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 415 PM PDT.
